website_summaries.verdict: Requires a little TLC at first, but otherwise, this heavy steel grill works well as either a portable grill or a side-mounted fire box for a bigger smoker.
pros: Grill bolts to a bigger smoker as a side fire box for cool smoking
Easy to clean with a side slide-out for the charcoal grate and ash pan
Heavy and sturdy, but small enough for an RV
cons: Paint tends to bubble and peel in high heat if grill isn't seasoned first
Grill door and grates can rust in damp weather if not seasoned or treated with heat-resistant paint
Reports of door not sealing properly, allowing smoke out

customer_reviews.title: Missing Hardware
customer_reviews.text: This review "could not be submitted in it's current form"? Much of the hardware was missing. I called Char Griller's customer service and they seemed indifferent to my frustration. I'm expecting replacement hardware in the next ten days or so. What's the point of fast shipping if the product is incomplete? I'm headed down to the hardware store to get my own parts as the Char-Griller seems to be incapable of meeting customer needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service at CHAR-GRILL NOT AMAZON.
customer_reviews.text: This is towards Char-Grill not amazon. This item lost all it's paint on the first use. not in one spot the entire top part and back it all bubble up and flake off within 10 mins. Per Char-Grill they would not warranty it if you used more than 15 little briskets to warm it with and we used wood and charcoal. So since they say we did it wrong it's not warranty. Well guess you really need to only use for hot dogs cause anything else it will heat up to much! Worst customer service more shocking than anything! Frustrated consumer! Amazon did everything as normal good service and shipping.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill !
customer_reviews.text: Nice little grill ! I was a little concerned when reading the reviews about the paint . I also have the Char-Griller 5050 unit , and in the directions on the 5050 it says to put a lite coat of cooking oil on it before use , I used Crisco , I also used it on the 2-2424 and have not had a problem at all .
customer_reviews.author: stillerpen

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty but necessary!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the quality and stoutness of this little grill. I've got a smoker box on my main grill and it's not nearly this well built. I bought this as my RV grill and love the size and heavy duty design. It's either light weight and junk or heavy duty and built to last. I haven't found an in between with grills. I added a temp thermometer to mine. The rack doesn't adjust the coals but I haven't found a reason to with this grill. I use less coals to start and add if need be. Adjust the air in/out and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Fogleman33

customer_reviews.title: Cheap paint ruins an otherwise great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a well designed grill that isn’t too hard to assemble and works extremely well. Unfortunately, as noted in previous reviews, the company made an absolutely horrible decision in covering the grill barrel with cheap, bottom-shelf paint that bubbles, peels and chips within a few uses. For some unfathomable reason they opted to ruin an otherwise great product with a nickel-saving decision that will leave your grill too rusted to use by the end of the year. Won’t buy another from them.
customer_reviews.author: motodoc817

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product... after 2 uses this is what i have... see photos... rated No Stars.......
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Harper

customer_reviews.title: GUARANTEED TO RUST>>>>DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd one, every one will rust. Junk is you ask me. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: This is an Add On for me
customer_reviews.text: I do a serious amount of cooking and I have decided to venture into smoking. I purchased a Char Griller charcoal grill and then I purchased this as the add on for smoking meats and fish. The grills are really well made with cast iron grates I can not say too much about cleaning or heat resistance until I really start using it when the weather breaks up here in New England I do recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Firpo

customer_reviews.title: Paint bubbles off on first use
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this product to smoke a turkey for Thanksgiving and immediately the paint bubbles off. The instructions inside said no returns if used but this is a defective product. I’m in hopes Amazon will let me return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably a good portable grill. Firebox? Not so much...
customer_reviews.text: Mounts easily to other Char-Griller grills as a firebox. However, after one use almost all of the paint had “cooked” off. After less than one month it is a rusted disgrace. All while being covered! Of course the warranty says that paint isn’t covered. Now I need to sand and repaint the whole box. I think I’ll just convert it back to a stand-alone grill. That seems to be all it can handle.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Mouser

customer_reviews.title: Bad paint
customer_reviews.text: First time I smoked in it all the paint blistered off and smelled like plastic. Within a month it's rusted. I see that the reviews on this are bad. If you buy this sand it and repaint it before the first use or you'll ruin an entire batch of meat.
customer_reviews.author: JJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Compact and durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful little grill. I had no trouble assembling this, but I find assembling Ikea funiture fun (your experiences may vary). Generally works well. I've used it for just about everything from burgers and brats to smoking pork butts (put a lair of foil under the rack to avoid direct heat). I haven't had an issue with the paint pealing, and I've kept it outside for over a year. The downside is that the charcoal is really only in the center of the grill, so the front and back edges are rather "cool".
customer_reviews.author: James Luehrmann

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed, qc is dead in this world
customer_reviews.text: As soon as i got it unpacked i noticed the sliding tray for wood or coal would not shut fully without a wrestling match. Twisting shoving and jamming the thing back shut. Im very dissapointed was going to go get the chargriller dou and attach this to it and now im left wondering about the quality and qc of this company. Im not going to put up with issues like this the thing should shut without any hassle, im trying to cool not fight with a metal box.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt like heat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased as an add on smoker box for my grill. The first use of this item after assembly was smoking some pork butt for barbeque. About 1-2 hours into the smoking process, The metal on this item began to flake paint and turn white. This happened in about 5 spots, some larger than my adult hand. After the cooldown, the white dust just wiped away leaving exposed metal to rust at first chance. I hope some heat rated spray paint will help me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Rusting and Pealing
customer_reviews.text: This product's coating pealed within the first two uses. The wire tray also is warping due to heat. The bare metal has begun to show on top due to heat and is now rusting.... I've used this 4 times in total. Not really sure how to not get rust since I'm in Washington State and I store everything under cover and with a grill cover as well.
customer_reviews.author: pnwvolks

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my chargriller 50/50
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and it seemed that the 2 biggest complaints were 1. Paint burns off and 2. Spacers on the bottom bolts were too short. In regards to #1 it is paint, not powder coated and it costs well under $100.00, so what did they expect. In regards to #2 my spacers were too long (see pics). I can trim the spacers and I'm actually happy they were too long, it is easier to take of metal than it is to add metal. All in all, great addition to my grill.
customer_reviews.author: GRUNT

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed Poor Manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept and design of this grill but the manufacturing is poor. The main door for food placement does not mate well with the main barrel due to its shape or radius differences in the two parts. This causes a significant air gap and makes regulating air flow difficult. The metal grate that the charcoal sit on is much thinner than what some competitor grills use. All of the hardware is low grade and ill fitting. During shipping some of the installed hardware had fallen off. I would gladly pay a little more for a grill like this with better craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This grill works great. Room for direct and indirect cooking
customer_reviews.text: This grill works great. Room for direct and indirect cooking. Great for camping, charcoal is contained which is important when camping in dry areas. Line bottom of charcoal tray with foil and makes clean up very easy. Slightly heavier than most small grills, attribute this to quality materials, well worth the few extra pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Portable Grill
customer_reviews.text: This is the same grill that got stolen from me. I bought this one for our spring event. It did the job. It cooked mostly from the right side bc the vents are down low near the charcoal. On the left the vents are up high so the air does not directly hit the charcoal so keep this in mind when you grill. The food will burn faster if positioned on the right side of the grill.
customer_reviews.author: PORTIA HOLLIDAY

customer_reviews.title: easy to put together works great
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty, easy to put together works great. If you are going to use this as a stand-alone portable grill be advised that the grates are very close to the coals. So you don't need much charcoal at all to cook 8 chicken thighs or a couple of rib eyes. Have used it several times and have had no issues with paint peeling. But that is not an issue, this is an outdoor, rugged long lasting grill, not a piece of art work.
customer_reviews.author: EJR

customer_reviews.title: Glad my Dad was a carpenter and I learned a few things!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was difficult. Hard to maneuver phillips screwdriver, easier with flathead. Nuts and bolts were irregular, and the reason for the pliers was not only for tightening the nuts but I had to shave down the screws for the ash tray handles (pic) and use the nuts in opposite ways. Ash tray welding is shoddy and faulty. There is daylight between the two pieces (pic). The uneven legs is a result of me being frustrated and not wanting to redo it. Will send an update after I season the grill ( inside and out), racks, and use it.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall excellent smoker/grill. I bought this as an attachment to my existing grill to use as a smoker. Only issue I had when installing was the support bolt and spacer for the bottom of the grill (picture provided). Spacer was way too short and if I did have the right size spacer than the bolt would have been short. Quick trip to the hardware store fixed the issue. Got two 2-1/2" bolts and two 1" spacers for each bolt. If you're a perfectionist 1-7/8" spacer would be a better fit. Other than that, I'm a fan of this smoker/grill.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grill on its Own
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this as a tailgating and porch grill, and it is definitely up to the task. I was a little wary about the paint issues that others have mentioned, but I have not seen any problems yet (after half a dozen grilling sessions). The side vents are easy to use, and the tray slides very well. Cooking with this little guy has been a breeze, and I love having the option of charcoal cooking when I have the time to devote to it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike J

customer_reviews.title: Best when used as a side smoker box
customer_reviews.text: If you are planning on burning actual logs in this as a side smoker box you will want to coat with at least 2 coats of high temp paint. If you do not it is prone to rust and peeling. My first venture in this product lasted for the better part of 8 years but looked like total garbage because I did not treat it. Over a year now with it painted in high temp paint and it still looks pretty good. Make sure to keep this out of the rain or it will rust exponentially faster.
customer_reviews.author: ralf kocher

customer_reviews.title: Maximize your Char Griller Pro
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I upgraded my Char-Griller Pro 2100 with this smoker. Been enjoying making all sorts of smoky meat with it. Gonna try smoking some tofu (veg jerky) and dried tomatoes next. I have used it as a little BBQ while attached to the main grill and it is handy for cooking as well. Gives you more grill space and you can have different types of configurations (direct Vs indirect) in the two grills.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Crow

customer_reviews.title: Paint will flake off, but otherwise will work as intended.
customer_reviews.text: The paint flaked off after the first use. I knew that would happen due to other reviews, but that doesn’t make it ok that they are using sub par paint on their grill. I will repaint it with better paint. The spacers provided are also not that great and when attached to the larger grill as a smoker it sags. I will be repainting it and hopefully I will be able to address the sag.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Finish on top of SFB cooked RIGHT OFF within 5 minutes of very first use!!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions from manufacturer to season this SFB and smoker grill for the first use precisely. Within five minutes of the first use, the finish on top of the SFB baked and bubbled right off!! Terribly disappointing. Contacted seller and am requesting refund or replacement (assuming just this one is defective and they don't all do this). See attached pics.
customer_reviews.author: Blatchford Sarnemington

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Attached to Char-Griller Duo 5050 purchased at Lowe's - fit perfectly and functions as expected. Update (Jan 2019) - While the box still functions as it should, the metal started rusting pretty significantly a while ago. The grill itself is two years older and doesn't have near as much rust as the box. We generally keep it under the CharGrill fitted cover (, but do forget to put it on occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Rita C

customer_reviews.title: They ruined a good design
customer_reviews.text: Years ago this firebox came with a door on the end instead of the drawer it has now. The door could be opened to optimize airflow and to remove ashes during long cooks like brisket or pork butt. The new design is very poor with the drawer. How are you supposed to clean out ashes during long cooks when your fire is sitting on top of the drawer? So I removed the drawer completely for longer cooks but now get only half the airflow as with the original design. Bring back the door!
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: Longer Hardware Necessary! char-griller be warned!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible fitment, char-griller needs to provide the correct length hardware instead of having the user custom fit or run to the hardware store for longer bolts and spacers. If OE hardware is used, the attachment box is tilted at a severe angle.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Good char griller addon smoker
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the char griller charcoal grill. Add this to the side and it makes for a good offset smoker. We used it for thanksgiving and it smoked a turkey, ham and some smoked sausage. It is easy to setup, use, and maintain temperature. Once it was smoking away you only need to add wood every 30 or 40 minutes. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Assemble by instructions.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality grill. Assembly isn't too bad, but do follow instructions. Before using be sure to prep the grill according to instructions also. It will need seasoning. If possible do not allow to get wet.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus L Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Really great
customer_reviews.text: My wife and kids gave me the big grill for Father’s Day and I wanted to add the side smoker box. It’s great. Takes a bit of work to install but the fit is perfect. I can also use it as a small grill if i just need to cook two steaks or patties for me and my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E Collins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit replacement firebox!
customer_reviews.text: I bought as a replacement firebox for a Char-Griller smoker. It bolted up perfect!! Very Easy to do. The only drawback is the paint will blister and peel off of these. I've owned a couple and they both done it. You can prevent some of it, especially when new if you start you charcoal in a chimney and not in the firebox. This keeps any high licking flames from catching the new pant and oil film a blaze. Add wood and let it catch, then close the lid.
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great fire box! But cheap paint...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent smoker box as long as you don’t care of the cosmetics after it’s first use! Paint starts to flake off the top due to the high temperatures when used as a side fire box. Nothing some sand paper and black high heat paint can’t fix. Food turned out great!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This grill will not last long
customer_reviews.text: While this grill works well, it is a small size, very heavy, the ash pan and charcoal grate is not sturdy and will rust out within a year or so. You could order replacement parts but for me it wasn't worth it. I went back to the old weber kettle grills. If this grill had better quality material in the hot area it would be a much better value. The design cooks very well.
customer_reviews.author: Tito E. Giron

customer_reviews.title: Worked exactly like it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Used this as a side fire box for my Char Griller Pro. Smoked beef and pork ribs. Maintained a reasonable;e temperature and after about 2 hours I had beautifull smoked meats come off for my family. Monitor your coal beds and always adjust your dampers to keep the heat where you want.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Baker

customer_reviews.title: We are not displeased at all but it would be nice if they adapted this
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this smoker. We read it before we bought and it clearly stated, once attached to the gas/charcoal grill it cannot be used as a stand alone. Just make sure you know this before you too order. We are not displeased at all but it would be nice if they adapted this, so it was removable. That would make it extra handy. Love it either way. Does take two sets of hands to install onto gas/charcoal grill. Be prepared for that. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri S

customer_reviews.title: It was a seriously great investment. I have the cover fitted for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Mounted right to the side of my Chargriller Legacy, even though it wasn't mentioned in fitment. I have used it twice not as a smoker box, and thankfully I haven't had any noob issues. It was a seriously great investment. I have the cover fitted for my particular grill and the cover fits wit hteh side box. I grill every Sunday. This is a total win.
customer_reviews.author: R Lofton

customer_reviews.title: Good smoker for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Father's Day. He already had the duo Grill that we had gotten at Lowe's and he really wanted the side fire box to complete the set. It took him about 30 minutes to install and some of the pieces he had to work with to get them to fit but it all came together nicely. It doesn't have to be added to the grill as it can be used as a standalone smoker. He is excited to try it out. So far very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tia M.

customer_reviews.title: Peeling and corroding within weeks
customer_reviews.text: While it works, the top of this attachment is already corroded and the coating peeling back. It started only a few weeks after we installed it onto the grill. We kept our last grill including all gadget attachments (not the same brand) for over 5 years so this smoker box deteriorating within months in a way that's not repairable is a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Quigs

customer_reviews.title: Smoker Add On
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this to use as a side fire box so I could have the option to smoke or indirectly cook food. My biggest concern was if it was going to fit since my Chargriller grill was several years old. I'm happy to say it fit perfectly, was very easy to install onto my grill, and works better then I was hoping. Only left me wondering why I didn't pursue doing this a long time ago
customer_reviews.author: Ron K

customer_reviews.title: Great sidebox addition
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for the buck. Product arrived as viewed in the images. It made a great addition to my Char-griller. I did find it difficult to take the side plate off my Char-griller after years of heat build up welding the screw holes almost shut. This has NOTHING to do with the functionality of this product. It's smokes extremely well and I recommend to anyone looking to smoke premium meats for the fraction of the cost of an egg.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Spivey

customer_reviews.title: Working good so far
customer_reviews.text: Read some reviews that there was a big problem with the paint peeling on the grill after one or two times used, but I haven’t had this problem with mine yet . I have used it about 10 times and it’s just fine . I use it attached to the side of my char-griller for indirect heat
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Great product, near perfect side fire box for gas grill
customer_reviews.text: A great design. I bought it to use as a side firebox for my grill, and it works very well for that. It took some time to develop the right technique for keeping the smoke fire going while cooking on the gas grill, but after a bit it was easy. The only design flaw is in the bottom of the unit. Since the grill is cast iron, it is important to keep it ash free and dry or it will rust. The ash drawer on the right hand side opens up to the sky, so water will tend to accumulate in the bottom of the unit when it rains. A simple drain hole will fix this problem.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tillman

customer_reviews.title: Great for using as a firebox
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in order to use it as a firebox for the Char-griller 3001 gas grill. It bolted up perfectly and was easy to install. The assembly was simple and it had it together and on the grill in under 30 minutes. It was handy to have two people while putting this on the grill (it's quite heavy). We seasoned the box for a couple hours with vegetable oil at 350 degrees. We love this addition!
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Manufactured
customer_reviews.text: There are huge gaps around the ash tray and around the lid. This makes it impossible to suffocate a fire after grilling, even with all the vents fully closed I still burn up all my coals to ash. This is a well designed grill, but the lack of oversight to its production has made it quite mediocre. I have not used it as a smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Bjengt

customer_reviews.title: like it says to do
customer_reviews.text: Soaked it with cooking oil and burned it off before 1st use, like it says to do, and no sign of rust or paint peeling. We use it as a grill for camping and I also use it at home once in a while, instead of the duo burn, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Truc

customer_reviews.title: Stout little grill, great for small parties, home cookin'
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine little table-top grill, stout and heavy. Lots of nuts, bolts and washers to assemble, but clear instructions. It took me about 30 minutes to assemble. This also doubles as a smoker attachment for its big brother. Clever concept.
customer_reviews.author: PickyPickyPicky

customer_reviews.title: Smoker
customer_reviews.text: This is what it looked like after one time smoking in it.this was a christmas present for my son and he sent me this picture after he used it once.☹
customer_reviews.author: Teresa. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty small grill
customer_reviews.text: Really heavy duty grill. Built with the same steel as their larger grills. Bought it to take camping in parks without grills. It's heavy so if your looking for something light weight pass this up. I haven't had the problem of paint peeling like some of the reviews but I only use charcoal in mine, no wood.
customer_reviews.author: Raymc

customer_reviews.title: Gunk all over grills.
customer_reviews.text: I’m sorry but is this gunk all over the grills normal? If it is, you would think that they might mention it in the instructions...wish I would have opened the grills before assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Great Scott

customer_reviews.title: Superb smoker!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little smoker! Modified with 4-6 inch duct piping to make a nice smoke chimney. Works well with mods. Very sturdy and heavy duty! Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Daley

customer_reviews.title: ... one with 2 burners not 3 and it works great as a somker
customer_reviews.text: hooked this up to my dual chargriller 5050 the one with 2 burners not 3 and it works great as a somker. the paint on the top of the pit chiped almost immediately on the first use so no 5 star because of that otherwise great add on to my grill
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little grill. There are just two of us, and we do not have a lot of space, so it is perfect. Plus there is a good deal of cook space if we are hosting a few friends for a cook out. I really like the easily removable tray for dumping the ashes. My husband mounted it to the railing of our deck, and we plan to use it year round.
customer_reviews.author: Marie McMullen

customer_reviews.title: Turns any compatible chargriller gas grill into a smoker.
customer_reviews.text: If your char griller gas grill has the removable panel on the side, this will allow you to smoke meats. It works surprisingly well.
customer_reviews.author: jimfrompa

customer_reviews.title: Very prompt delivery
customer_reviews.text: The smoker was delivered very promptly. However, the package has not yet been opened and the smoker has not yet been installed or tried out. The item was ordered for a Christmas present and has not yet been opened or installed. I ordered it for my husband to use on his combination gas/charcoal grill. The package was delivered very promptly after my submittal of the order. Unfortunately, it was placed on our deck where we enter the house and was in a manufacturer's box that showed what was inside. Although this present was a surprise to him, it did not make it under the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: great smoker
customer_reviews.text: Love this smoker side box. Make sure you season this too as well as oil it occasionally - we have had NO issues with the paint peeling off at all. Great additional to our grill.
customer_reviews.author: Emily B.

customer_reviews.title: Good but spacers to short
customer_reviews.text: I've used it twice and did the job I got it for. The 2 spacers that come with it are too short. I had to go to local hardware store to get longer bolts and make spacers. The manufacturer needs to fix this problem. I see other reviews have the same problem. Besides that it did what it's suppose to do.
customer_reviews.author: J D.

customer_reviews.title: There are more bots left over when you use it as a fire box
customer_reviews.text: Had my grill for a while but wanted to add a fire box,fix prefect an I did it alone,i put the fire box in a chair push it close to my grill an I went to work,love it can't wait to smoke some meat.THX AMAZON..
customer_reviews.author: lewis sanders

customer_reviews.title: So glad i decided to purchase this add on for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. So glad i decided to purchase this add on for my grill. Should just bought the package to begin with. Never thought smoking my own meat would be so good. If you put in the time and effort, because smoking meat does take a lot longer, the taste, smell, and satisfaction is worth it. Taste better when you do it yourself too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Built well and does the job nicely. My only real complaint is the stand-offs supplied ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as the side firebox for the larger dual fuel Char-Griller grill. Built well and does the job nicely. My only real complaint is the stand-offs supplied to support it and keep it level when installed as a side firebox are about 1/2 inch too short, noticeably making it off kilter from the rest of the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: The fit and finish of the fire box is great except for the lid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to convert my Chargriller Pro into a smoker. The fit and finish of the fire box is great except for the lid. The curvature of the lid is nowhere close to that of the firebox. I tried to flatten it a bit to seal better as it was gapped open about 3/8" at the highest point on each side but the steel lid is pretty thick and unwilling to bend. I ended up using a combination of 1/4" and 3/8" furnace gasket to seal up the gap and installed a latch to hold it shut.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Shaver Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good Grill with Weak Welds
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a Christmas gift. Overall the grill is solid and assembly was pretty simple. The only negative is that the welds on the legs are pretty weak and one of mine arrived broken. Other than that the rest of the grill had a good fit and finish.
customer_reviews.author: H.E. Pennypacker

customer_reviews.title: poor
customer_reviews.text: the place where you put the grates was busted off. I can only now use it as a fire box only.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: It’s really heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with this little grill. We are amazed at the quality for the price. The cast iron grates are easy to remove with the handy tool that comes in the box. Grill has good flue venting and really holds the heat a lot better than grills with thin metal construction. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great add on to my grill
customer_reviews.text: Was a great addition to my dual charcoal/butane grill. Attached perfectly and was up and running as a side wood box in a couple of hours. I do thou see it would be a pain to take off and use as a stand alone grill, but for a side fire box works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Phelan

customer_reviews.title: Paint peeled on second use.
customer_reviews.text: Paint began peeling off after second use as a side box smoker. Assembled to char griller grill without issue and cooks well but cheap paint job. Now I have to repaint this to prevent rust.
customer_reviews.author: Dice

customer_reviews.title: Great for firebox
customer_reviews.text: Great add on to my chargriller grill. I’m using it as a side fire box and seasoned it like instructions said and after many many uses it has no paint peeling like so many people in reviews said happened to them. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: Bad Craftmanship, do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst products I've ever purchased. The door will not close and the firebox will not close completely. I just put it together this weekend. Please do not waste your money buying this. I used mine as a side firebox. It's not even worth the price. Money lost.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY ONE
customer_reviews.text: I won’t buy another one first time I used it as a smoke box all the paint burnt off, the temperature didn’t go over 175
customer_reviews.author: Cityguy

customer_reviews.title: PAINT BURNS OFF VARY EASILY
customer_reviews.text: I FLOWED THE INSTRUCTIONS TO COAT INSIDE OF BOX AND THE CAST IRON RACKS OF GRILLER WITH VEGETABLE OIL. THEN HEAT TO 300 DEGREES FOR 2 HR TO BURN IN OIL TO STOP RUSTING. I FOLLOWED INSTRUCTIONS EXACTLY. THE PAINT BURNED OFF. I CONTACTED WARRANTY DEPARTMENT OF CHAR-GRILLER AND WAS TOLD THAT IT WAS MY FAULT. AND I SHOULD SAND AND PAINT IT. I HAVE NO IDA WHY THEY WOULD POWER COAT THE GRILLER INSTEAD OF PAINTING IT WIDTH HIGH HEAT PAINT LIKE THEY TOLD " ME" TO DO.
customer_reviews.author: gary f.

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% happy
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain to attach to the side of my grill. You will need help as it is too heavy to hold up your self while you are attaching it. After we got it attached, we used it, and the paint immediately started peeling off of the top. It works well but I'm not 100% happy with it. It went from brand new to looking like it's been sitting outside in the rain for 5 years in one use.
customer_reviews.author: Ranico

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill. Recommend reading the booklet prior to first use
customer_reviews.text: my friend absolutely loves it! He was so excited to use it tgat he neglected to read the instructions regarding first use of the grill & seasoning it, so the very hot fire made the paint come off. But aside from that he is crazy about it!
customer_reviews.author: Skyeboy

customer_reviews.title: Instructions for turning into a fireside box are not present ...
customer_reviews.text: Instructions for turning into a fireside box are not present and made it a guessing game. Also, first time using, almost 70% of the paint flaked off... Ordering a replacement, we'll see if I just got a defective unit. Update: Got replacement, but like the original unit the paint didn't last through the first use. I also ended up purchasing a latching system and food safe gasket to keep it sealed as much as possible, there were several air leaks between the fire box and main grill and around the cover itself.
customer_reviews.author: nbiron

customer_reviews.title: This is a great addition. I've used it now 3 times
customer_reviews.text: I bought this smoker to add to my gas/charcoal side by side. This is a great addition. I've used it now 3 times. It rather simple to control the head with the side damper. It has a nice slide out tray to add wood and remove Ash. The only thing that gave me trouble was the support bushings and bolts were too short so I had to add washers and get longer bolts.
customer_reviews.author: travis marshall

customer_reviews.title: Good smoker box attachment
customer_reviews.text: Only 2 stars for heat resistance the paint cracked around the lid the first time I used it. Other than the paint bubbling it works great
customer_reviews.author: henry f.

customer_reviews.title: It sort of works.  Not very good seal.  Rusted significantly after just a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: This smoker attachment is OK... Could use a seal to help prevent heat and smoke loss. Also while I just put it on my grill, I'm saddened to see that it's already significantly rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Rose

customer_reviews.title: It attached easily and looked good
customer_reviews.text: I have a chargriller grill that I was attaching this onto as a smoke box. It attached easily and looked good. But...Im not sure if I got a knock off or not, but not long after I fired it up with a little pile of charcoal the outside started to smoke. Then the paint started to bubble and finally it burst into flames. Otherwise it works fine, but its hard not to work when the entire function is to hold a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Supplanter

customer_reviews.title: Rusts easily
customer_reviews.text: We returned this grill as we had not even had it put together before it began to rust - inside and out. As previous reviews were so one way or the other, I was hoping for the better.
customer_reviews.author: crickert62

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty. Liked the. Shape and size.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact. Many parts to be assembled. Good quality and heavy duty. Not easy to clean but its charcoal after all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: attaches to the 3001 almost perfect. so there are two 2" bolts and some ...
customer_reviews.text: attaches to the 3001 almost perfect. so there are two 2" bolts and some tube spacers included with the hardware to bolt it to the chargriller bbq's, and the tubes are twice the size they need to be. i cut one in half and then it was the right size.
customer_reviews.author: stanley martin macias 2

customer_reviews.title: Paint flaked off during first use...
customer_reviews.text: Started rusting immediately after the first use. And the paint peeled off DURING the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Harley H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Havent used yet but no issues assembling. Im going to add this to my grill as a smoker. So far i noticed a few open areas due to manufacturing. Very small areas such as the pull out tray will were the coals go does not completely close. But its nothing a little high temperature heat sealant cant fix. Im happy with
customer_reviews.author: Nicks

customer_reviews.title: Paint peeled
customer_reviews.text: This item does attach well, and seems sturdy built. However, on first use, the paint peeled and came off at the top of the loading door. For the customary quality of Char Griller products, this finish falls far short..
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Small mods for hardware needed..
customer_reviews.text: I hade to make a few modifications, to attach to grill and make it sturdy. Initially i installed with the current hardware and it was somewhat flimsy. I added longer screws on the bottom and bushings to keep the spacing and it worked great. I use it as a smoker and it is awesome. Best addition to the grill.
customer_reviews.author: ELISEO GALINDO

customer_reviews.title: slow smoking or steak like a pro..
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd char-griller,the first one lasted 10yrs , a real person answers the phone when I did have to buy a new door on my first grill.... putting the lite charcoal on the door air side and food on the other side will smoke ribs and chicken just like a fancy restaurant..dynamite...will buy a 3rd...
customer_reviews.author: Donny B

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill, awesome smoke box
customer_reviews.text: Birthday present for my self and what a good one it is. Using it as a side smoker box for my gas/charcoil combo grill. My grill is of a diferent brand but with some self tapper screws and and extra hand i was hable to make it work. Beef jerky is great and quick, chicken is juicy but our favorite was a bone in ham
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: As it was everything was there and installation was very easy. The grill was a late addition to my ...
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the installation and thought it would be difficult. I was also concerned it would not fit properly and if the bolts and spacers were included with the purchase. As it was everything was there and installation was very easy. The grill was a late addition to my barbecue. I am very pleased with the item.
customer_reviews.author: richard marion

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for our motor home and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for our motor home and very sturdy. You will be shocked at the weight of this grill! I made a bread rack for it but still give it 5 stars because it is so well built. The manufacturer should add a bread rack
customer_reviews.author: MilesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great side fire box!
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the char griller duo/double play. I have used this as a side fire box multiple times now and it's great! Installation was super easy too! If you're into smoking meats, this is definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart T.

customer_reviews.title: as we expected
customer_reviews.text: we purchased and used this as the smoker attachment to our chargriller and it is easy to assemble and use it. we purchased our grill at a local home improvement store and intended to buy the smoker attachment there as well. however, the amazon model was $15 cheaper and qualified for free shipping--i don't mind waiting a week to get my stuff, as long as it saves me money! now, i still need to work on my meat-smoking techniques, but the equipment is just like we expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Adamson

customer_reviews.title: Not heat resistant paint
customer_reviews.text: A lot of paint burnt off on the firebox exposing bare metal, This was after the first use. I'm sure that will lead to rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Cory K.

customer_reviews.title: Low quality paint
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the grill for many years rust free, then installed this unit and it has rusted in the first month of usage and the paint is peeling off. Aside form that its a pretty heavy and decent unit but could use a seal on the lid
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Fits and works great
customer_reviews.text: This add-on works great, the hardware that came with it did not fit, However called customer service and they promptly sent out the right hardware that has the longer screws "At NO Charge"! great customer service, what else can i say I'm happy with the product and customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt L.

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing a char griller dual fuel grill I wanted to add the smoke box, unfortunately the quality is not the same, after first use the paint started peeling off I contacted customer service which just made me jump through hoops for almost two weeks only to tell me to sand it and spray it with black paint
customer_reviews.author: Jarwin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Husband was looking to add a smoker to are already charcoal gas grill this was perfect that you could add it on to that we ended up smoking a turkey at Thanksgiving and it turned out wonderful. Packages is very heavy and took about 30 minutes to add on to the grill
customer_reviews.author: AshChen17

customer_reviews.title: What a great smoker!
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the easiest system yo install, use as a smoker, or charcoal grille. Very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: William Durham

customer_reviews.title: I still use it as it's only used to hold my charcoal but is still a great investment for smoking on Char-Griller grills
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use it as a side box but just as all other reviews states, it will peel the paint off on first use. I still use it as it's only used to hold my charcoal but is still a great investment for smoking on Char-Griller grills.
customer_reviews.author: Dima1518

customer_reviews.title: It's "okay"
customer_reviews.text: Well, product isn't bad, BUT like the other reviews I myself do have quite a few problems that bug me. First, the ash tray is twisted and won't properly stay shut, gaps open. That's my main bug about it. Secondly, the fire box does bubble and I followed the seasoning instructions... ugh! Lastly, the spacing tubes are to short.. paying this much for something should hold up for a minimum of a year, and come with all parts needed even if I am gonna have extra. ((I really can't stand the twist of the ash pan, that realllllly bugs me! ))
customer_reviews.author: shawn

product_meta.title: Char-Griller E22424 Table Top Charcoal Grill and Side Fire Box, Black
product_meta.description: The Char-Griller Table Top Grill and Side Fire Box 2-2424 is a charcoal grill or side smoker. It is interchangeable from a grill to a smoker (once changed it cannot go back to a grill). The primary cooking surface is 250 square inches. The grates are cast iron. It features a sliding drawer for easy access to coals and/or ashes. The ash pan dumps easily. Chargriller "Always Well Done".
feature_bullets: Removable ash pan for easy coal clean up
Attaches to all Char-Griller barrel grills (#2123, #2828, #2137 and the #5050 Duo Gas and Charcoal Grill)
Use as a table top grill or horizontal Texas style smoker
You can go from a grill to a side fire box, once done you cannot go back to the grill
Fits the Chargriller Pro Deluxe, Wrangler, Outlaw and Duo as a Side Fire Box
Heavy steel construction, Cast iron cooking grates, 250 -square inch of primary cooking space
Sliding drawer for easy access to coals and ashes, Easy dump ash pan and Stay Cool hood handle

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,245 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
